Ordered the chicken fajitas to go and the staff was amazing. The chicken pieces were big and very tender, juicy and well seasoned along with the onions and peppers. Meal came with a huge bag of chips and a hearty serving of salsa. Definitely a must go to. Authentic Mexican food, amazing atmosphere and a very welcoming staff.

This restaurant was busy and I am so glad we decided to wait for a table! The food was amazing. The wait staff was attentive, friendly, and funny. The drinks were good. We even had ducks out on the patio with us! Will definitely return when I visit Phoenix again!

Do you want delicious Mexican food with great service at an affordable price? Then this shit hole is not for you! We waited an hour and a half for food without any apology from our clueless classless waitress. When we asked what was going on, she said the kitchen had "a big ticket ahead of us still" and walked away. It even took 30+ minutes for us to get a drink. Total joke. But what does our idiot waitress care? They built in a 20% tip to our already expensive bill! Pass on this dump at ALL costs...you'll be happy you did!

I grew up around here... before there was the Pointe at South Mountain and any of the office suites that line baseline road there was orange groves and nestled within were cool old houses along with a Mexican restaurant called Juan Tanamera's.  In fact my dad's friend built his house there and I have pictures from the 70's of my dad helping to build this house.  My dad would bring my sister and I here for dinner often... the food was great and we always had a great time.  Once the Pointe was built they bought the Mexican restaurant and named it Aunt Chilada's.  Everything changed... the menu was different, the staff was different.  The only thing that remained the same was the structure of the building and the cool ponds that surrounded it which no longer have coy but sometimes an occasional duck.  I agree with the other reviewers of this place that the service is lack luster and the food is OK.  There is one thing I like here and that is the albondigas soup... small bite sized meatballs with veggies and a savory broth; they also put fideo noodles in it which makes it even better.  I do crave this soup and since it is very close to my work i often call in an order of it.  Every time I walk in to pick it up it always brings up fond memories from the past.

Service was incredible, our server Marcia was all over drink refills and extra chips and salsa. She recommended the fajitas and they were superb, not cheap on the chicken and steak, the tortillas were warm and fresh, atmosphere is very laid back. Best Fajita's in town!!

Oh Dear Aunt Chilada, where did you go?  When I was young we would go out to eat on very special occasions.  I remember the excitement of going to Aunt Chilada's for birthday dinners and having a great time.    I'm not sure if it's the childhood memories not holding up, or the change in management, but Aunt Chilada's truly disappointed me.  We went with a part of four, and I was the only person who had been there before.  The interior and décor was EXACTLY as I remembered it, meaning that in 15 years, I don't think they've even touched up the paint.  Once seated, we found that the room was very noisy, with only 3 parties in the room.  It was also extremely crowded, with tables much closer than they needed to be.  The service was adequate, other than sitting dry waiting for more drinks.  They did bring chips and salsa quickly, and the staff was polite.  Now, to the part that was so heartbreaking for me.  The food.  Meh about sums up what I thought.  I tried a little off of everyone's plate, and across the board it was so-so.  Nothing inspired me, nothing stood out.  While it's still better than Taco Bell, it really seemed like they were phoning it in.  There was no symphony of flavors, nothing unexpected.   All in all, this is a good place to take your East Coast relatives who can't handle spice, for a stereotypical Mexican meal.  It's kind of like the Disney version of Mexico.  For natives like myself, especially those who either cook their own food, or love a little spice and excitement, don't waste your time.
Food was ok maybe would have been better if I could actually eat it instead of swating all the flies away

Expensive bland very Americanized Mexican food. Probably good for tourist who like mile Pace salsa FRM the grocery store. Probably what bothered me the most was all the rescued on expenses fur adding things like green chiles $1 onions $1 cheese $1.75. Our iced tea was $3. Not to of this works prices but kinda high. Service was ok, they got us what we asked for but without a smile or any enthusiasm. Beautiful location though!

We were seated promptly, but found service to be slow, all around, receiving drinks, ordering dinner, and eventually receiving our meals. Time from arrival to food was 45 minutes. Chips were good, and chunky salsa had an enjoyable flavor. I ordered steak fajitas, and found that they were tender, but had a very off taste, similar to a dirty grill possibly. Off taste was more noticeable as meal went on resulting in eating less than one third of the entree before deciding I was better off avoiding it. Bill was dropped on table shortly after, no discussion of food quality, offer of drink refills, or other standard practices. This location is not related to another restaurant bearing the same name in Phoenix. Slow service and off tasting food resulted in the low rating.
See my tip;) family friendly, good service, American Mexican food. Large portions. Enjoyed the tacos and sangria Rita. No problems.

Food was good and so were the drinks. The problem was getting them. Bar tenders were really bad, and the bar is only bout 8 foot long. If it is busy expect to be ignored for at least 15 minutes. Order drinks and food together, it will take a while to see her again. Happened all 3 times I went. Like another review said typical resort restaurant.

Always like the atmosphere. The water going in, the patio is really a great place to take family members when they are down on vacation. Service is usually good, some servers are better then others the two veteran ladies are awesome if you get them. They are knowledgeable and give A service the new ones could learn from them. Food is good and they have a nice tequila selection.
We had a wonderful lunch at Aunt Chiladas! Great food, exceptional service and Ashley's table side guacamole was amazing!!! Thanks Ashley!
Loved the atmosphere outside. Prompt, courteous service and fantastic food and drinks.I'll definitely return!

Best service by EVERYONE (hostesses, bartender, and server)! This is refreshing. The people eating here are even awesome! Best energy and vibe I have had in a long time. Gloria is an amazing server! Lover her! Food a little dry but honestly don't care - that's how welcoming and great these people are....I can deal with a Lil dryness in the food....just not In The people :)  Will be back.

Now that's some great Mexican food! I went with a group to Aunt Chilada's this past weekend and everyone had a great time. Made reservations which is always key because the place was packed and we were seated right away. Our waitress was friendly and the margaritas started flowing! Food came and it was hot and the portions were large, I felt like I was at a Italian restaurant. Overall we had a great time and the staff was friendly and really went the extra mile ensuring a great evening.   PS. Make sure to order the "hot" salsa and Cheese crisp for an appetizer. Delicious!

We live in the valley. Mexican food is everywhere.  This place is way over priced for Mexican food.  In the past I would have given 3 stars over priced Mexican food that was ok, nothing special, but okay.  After eating here on Tuesday I will never return.  The beef chimi made me very sick, a very unpleasant experience.

I dont want to give Auntie even a one star.. On a beautiful Saturday, my friends  wanted to go sit and have something to drink & have an app , or two. This is tops for happy hour places, that's why we chose it. We opted to sit at the bar outside.. All the tables were reserved for a shower. Every time we were spoken to.. bc no one manned the bar.. it was rudely. We got a cerveza and a marg.. at least those you cant really fail on. The salsa was horrid...& I usually love the Aunts salsa.. we ordered sopapillas.. asked to have them first.. Umm guess not.. THEY never arrived.. Our water ran empty.. our chips and not-so-much salsa ran out... THE end was when our nachos.. had a hair on top.. we told the curt waitress.. & she rolled her eyes and said sorry.. We never saw her again.. THE thing is.. I usually LOVE this place for it's patio and good food , but tonight .. .. I DONT think SO! I left with my appetite ruined.

The food was delicious and the price was right, but a bit on the higher end. Went for a work luncheon and was quite satisfied with my burrito. During the spring time the outdoor seating is wonderful (but only under the treasurer because it's cooler).

Very authentic tasting food. Very generous portions. Service was friendly and environment was authentic. Nachos appetizer was a meal in itself. Very good. I'd recommend this place when you're in the area. Has a gluten free menu too!

Great Mexican food and very nice servers and bartenders.  Margaritas are also very good.  Little on the expensive side and no lunch menu only a happy hour menu from 3-6 but this place is also a part of a top notch resort so I expected it to be a little pricey.

I came in with my fiance last week for lunch. He is not a fan of Mexican food but the ambiance was great. Our server Jenny went above and beyond and suggested the Pollo Fundido. He loved it! She was very attentive. We will definitely be back.

It's been awhile since I've eaten here for lunch, let alone eating here for dinner.  Therefore, since we were in the Tempe area attending a symposium, and had to stop by Fry's Electronics; we decided to give this place a try since it was just across Baseline Road, and it was already past 9PM.  The entrance, the bridge over the mini pond, the patio, and the overall exterior appearance was just very inviting. We were encouraged that this may turn out to be a good spontaneous choice for this evening late dinner.  When we entered, the hostess greeted us and notified us that there would be a 15-20 minute wait. Although there were plenty of available tables as it was later in the evening, and the place wasn't really that busy; we chalked it up to just standard operating procedure in preparation prior to guests being seated.  It didn't really take that long for them to buzz us, and guide us to our seats. The hostess provided us with two menus, and then the adventure began.  When we started perusing the two page menu, it appears that whomever used these last had poured remnants of salsa and minute pieces of chips onto this menu, as it was all over the backside of both mine and my wife's. We had to quickly grab and use the napkins we had to clean ourselves up from the annoying mess. We flagged down our server, Marcia, and she graciously apologized, and quickly gathered up cleaner menus.  Upon returning, she informed us that she would get us chips and salsa (we could've eaten the ones that were on the menus, but that would be gross and there wasn't enough of it anyway =) ).  However, she got busy, and in passing, she informed us that one of the other servers would do so. That did not happen, and when she realized that we still hadn't gotten what she promised us, she went ahead and took care of it and took our order.  Now, here's the quandary with this place at night. I am a firm believer in romantic candle lit dinner places, as long as there is enough ambient light from "somewhere" (including a well lit candle) so as to be able to read the menu. Such was not the case here. It was dimly lit in certain areas that I had to use my cell phone's flashlight app to provide enough lighting so that we could read our menus and know what to order.   Now, if you think that this was an anomaly, and we were just being particular about this. The 3 separate groups of new arrivals on the other side of the room did the same exact thing as we did. The gentlemen who sat alone across from us had to walk across the room to get enough lighting to read his bill. And Marcia, our server, had pull out her phone to light up ours and other guests' bills to verify the total. Not sure what is going on here, but a little bit more spot lighting in certain places would go a long way to solving this minor annoyance. In any case, this is the reason why I have no pictures as I ran down my phone's battery to light up the menu.  I had the shredded beef burro (enchilada style), and a shredded beef taco. My wife had the Chimichanga.   The flavor wasn't bad, but we've had better. However, after a long day of sparse sustenance, we were famished enough that we were able to consume our meails.  I had the flan for dessert. It was too sweet for my taste, and it didn't have enough caramel on top. It tasted like it was pre-packaged.  All in all, it was a mediocre experience that didn't start out well, but ended on a slightly higher note which is why this review is 3 stars, and not 2 - especially with the miscue on the salsa filled menus. Someone should really be checking these before handing them out to guests. I thought that is what the hostesses were supposed to do. Perhaps, I am mistaken.  Marcia, our server, was just very efficient and she managed to recover what could've been a disastrous experience for us.  In any case, it was a beautiful night, and had beautiful company; so I never did mind too much the missteps of this place.
Service was prompt and attentive. Food was served quickly and was great. Recommend the creamy jalepeno sauce on the chimichanga!
I do not know why this  place got so many low ratings. Decent mexican food and nice service. The margaritas are wonderful. The decor is cheeky cute!

I'm not one to usually complain and you can see that on my review history but this place offers terrible terrible service, slow service (they weren't busy) and overpriced food and drinks. Wasn't impressed w/ the food and for sure will never return.

Hate doing this but for a 13$ margarita after tip I had to. I came in for a Cadillac margarita with hornitos and grand marnier like I did last week. I got a different glass and a different liquor. I asked if it had grand manier, since I seen what looked like a citrus patron bottle on the counter. She said they were out of grand marnier! How Do you run out of grand marnier at a Mexican restaurant?  I seen three bottles of grand marnier sitting on the shelf a foot away from me.

Bland and tasteless except the Talapia which tasted like olives and was sent back. The service was slow and inattentive. The only redeeming quality was the chips. While they were fresh and hot, the salsa was not. Even with extra heat requested, the salsa was bland. This is definitely not a Mexican restaurant any Mexican would be caught dead patronizing. It is definitely a place for gringos with no taste or high expectations.

Passable.  Good for big groups.  The queso is better than the chips and salsa.  The various menu items *sound* incredible, and what I've had wasn't bad by any means, but not particularly memorable either.  Extremely convenient if you're staying at the hotel next door though, definitely worth it in that case.

The salsa is good and the service is genuine. The food, however, isn't the best. My enchilada and chile relleno were quite tasty but the rice and fideo were not good. They were burnt and crispy...not a good kind of crispy! The tinga tacos were tasty but that's about it, taco-wise, because the other taco types didn't have much flavor at all...to the point that my husband couldn't even finish them. The margaritas are on point, though! This might me more the type of place where you have a few drinks and that's about it.

Grandma used to semi toast the tortillas for our tacos in Guatemala. Never have I found a place that does that.  Thank you aunt enchiladas for giving me a ratatoui moment. Bringing me back to my country. The staff is not only top notch but Marcia made an effort to talk in Spanish with no accent at all. It was beautiful.   I think I will come back several times, specially when I get homesick.

I first went to this restaurant over 20 years ago, might have been soon after it opened.  We had wonderful food that first time.  I still remember having the carnitas (pork) burro.  We went a second time a month or so later and the deterioration had already set in.  I ordered the same burro and it was very dry.  About a year later I took relatives there and again tried the carnitas burro and it was again dry and uninspired.  No one else raved about their food but things overall were still average.   Now to the recent experience... Over the past 3 months group of people and myself wanted to meet and talk at a restaurant so THEY choose ACs on two occasions.  I was hoping for a good experience but it was even worse than my last one  years ago.  On both occasions the service was quite slow.  On the second visit the server literally said, you should order now cuz you probably won't see me again soon and see was in a hurry to get the orders and get out.  I suspect the owners purposely understaff.  I would have again ordered carnitas but they no longer offer it except with a very high priced combo meal. So I ordered my other go to choice, a Green Burro, for both these visits.  Both times it was no better than average and overpriced.    The chips and salsa are also just average.  As another reviewer mentioned, the salsa tastes like they cut it with canned tomato sauce, it's soupy and has no bit whatsoever.   I don't know how this place stays in business.

We lived in Phoenix in the 1980s-1990s, moved away, and now are back.   Aunt Chilada's was one of our favorites then and were eager to return.   I was not disappointed!   We were there after the lunch rush on a Friday afternoon and got top-notch service and happy hour specials.   The food was very delicious.   I ordered then tamale and it was so much larger than what I'm used to.   The rice was perfect and the received beans were smoky. The salsa and chips were fresh and tasty.   I recommend sitting outside if the weather permits.   It had great ambiance with all the plants and ponds.

There were some pro's about this place: Service was decent and some of the food was really good. However, other food was just meh. The items that were good: Salsa had lots of onions in it which made me happy (I am a big onion lover!) and had a really good fresh flavor, the chips were nice and crisp, the jalapeno cream sauce that came with my numero ocho (8) combo was delicious with just the right amount of spice, and the fideo that the hubby ordered was different but I really enjoyed it (hubby said it was too plain for him). Now onto the other food: Hubby said his pork chimichanga wasn't bad and that the pork was cooked well but needed more seasoning, my chili relleno was ok but the batter had a weird texture to it, and my spinach enchilada was not very good at all. I like to have other components inside the enchilada rather then just plain spinach and unfortunately, these just had lumps of unflavored spinach with nothing else. So all in all, I would say this place was ok. There were some items that are good enough for me to come back but I would just try something else on the next visit.

Cold, under done chips. If a Mexican food restaurant can not get this staple right how can I expect them to get much more right.  I arrived for a party that my autocross group was having. Every table had chips and salsa on it. Sombreros were used as the server platters. Senor I don't think this even meets health code.   Dinner was served Buffet Style, one of the dishes was called "fandito." I can't think of a less inspired dish. It was simple pasta with some Mexican flavors thrown it, a dish that your mother would make if she had leftovers from Mexican Italian nights.   I like really like Mexican food, however I left this place hungry as I did not even want to try any of the dishes other than the salad.

We are from Colorado. The ambiance was the first thing that grabbed our attention. The cute path to the restaurant patio was a great start. The weather was perfection. We loved the outdoor tables and chairs were comfortable. We had 2 rounds of house margs and both were outstanding. We got chips and 2 kinds of salsa, one spicier which my hubby liked. We both thoroughly enjoyed our meals. I had a steak dish with cheese enchilada. Hubby had a crazy big bowl filled with chicken, steak, and jumbo shrimp. He LOVED it! We really enjoyed our experience and are so glad we gave this place a try!

We went here thinking the food would be the same as one at the Squaw Peak Pointe. It's not. Different owners I found out when I was there. The food was horrible. Honesty, I would have enjoyed Taco Bell more. There was nothing authentic about the Mexican food served here. It tasted like it came out of a can. The other Aunt Chilada's is far superior. Go there.

Best advice I can give, ask for the flour chips instead of corn, it'll change your life! Cute restaurant with a lot of personality located right off the resort on Baseline near Arizona Mills mall and the I-10. They have plenty of indoor and outdoor seating for any preference and party size. The food is typical American-Mexican with lots of cheese (not a bad thing) but, a bit overpriced in my opinion- I think that stems from being so close to a hotel. The service is just ok, not spectacular, so be prepared to wait a bit for a refill. I'd recommend the steak fajitas ($17) and the table side guacamole ($12).

OUTSTANDING menu, atmosphere and service! It felt like dining in Old Town San Diego.  And this is the first time I found healthy menu items on a Mexican restaurant menu, if fact there were many! Will return again and again! Located right off I-10 & Baseline.

The spicy salsa that you get when you sit down is great.  The queso dip - not spot much, it was cold and firm.  The table side guacamole was also good, the enchilada with jalepeno sauce on top - not that good.  The margarita was pretty good.  The service was spot on and we gave a good tip.  I am sure this place could be better but it did serve the purpose of not having to leave the resort property to have that "dining out" experience.

Food was pretty okay.  Good rice and beans. Service was lacking.  Took her almost 10 minutes to get to us the first time and she wasn't very pleasant.  If you can't handle a 6 table section (1 of the tables had 1 person 4 of them had 2 people and pretty sure one had already paid, plus our 3 people and then a table of 4), you shouldn't get one.  Thought some of the prices were a tad high for MExican food but it is at a resort.  Not sure if would go back just because of the service.

Upon arrival you give them your text number and you receive a text when your table is ready. Friday at noon, we only waited 10 minutes. First time here. Great waitress, very helpful. Food was great. I didn't think it was very pricey. I would go again. We ordered guacamole with the chips/salsa they brought. Daily special was good. Parking is plentiful. Right off I-10.

What a great place! We went with a party of 9 tonight and had the best service. Chips and salsa were out quickly and the margaritas were on par. My favorite part of the meal were the fish tacos. They are amazing! The sauce on the tacos was delicious! Thanks for the great service and food! We will be back!
Our server was wonderful and described multiple dishes to us.  Her recommendations were wonderful.  The food was plentiful and great.

Lovely outdoor patio and the best Mahi Mahi street tacos I've ever had! I mixed the hot salsa with the mild for a perfect blend (for a northerner) and ate more light salty chips than I should have. I'm here all week for work and will be back!!

My husband and I had our first date here together. For our 1 year anniversary we came back and we couldn't help but brag a little to our waiter. She thought it was so cool that she brought out a little chocolate cake for us, free of charge. It was a huge serving and very tender and smooth.   This would be good for a wedding reception as their banquet room next to the restaurant is huge. They skimped big time on the bar. It's a sad little nook to the side, hardly elbow room at the puny stool table.   And oh yeah - the food is kinda bland here. Just your average Mexican restaurant that seems to thrive only on account of it being off the I-10.

Perhaps management has been paying attention to Yelpers. Our service tonight was awesome!  My wife, daughter, and I spent a lovely evening enjoying decent Mexican food and each other's company. Our waitress was great ! Never did we have to ask for refills on anything...chips or drinks.   Contrary to recent Yelps, our food arrived SUPER fast...on a Friday night...when the waitress had to traverse multiple dining rooms to serve us.  Now, being at a resort, the food WAS a bit pricey...though, the price was easier to bear after 32 ounces of a margarita they call "El Diablo"...which is a top shelf margarita with Grand Marnier (as per my tip).  Either way, not a bad restaurant...plus, it's within walking distance of the resort, which comes in handy after about half of that El Diablo.

Food was mediocre. Steak was warm and under cooked. We had to send it back. The 40 minute wait ended up being and hour and 20 minutes. Maybe it had to due to the fact that they were catering an 80th birthday party, but still they should have a backup plan. On the upside, the fideo was delish!

I'm being grumpy because I have had far worse food. I drank water that tasted like my swimming pool. Chips obviously not fresh. Salsa tasted like canned tomatoes.  my Chili renno was not bad. Rice and beans not bad. Overall I enjoyed the meal. But for Arizona this place is lame. Also server had the personality of a cartel thug

Food is maybe slightly above average in my opinion.  I have always had great service, however.  Reliable place to go if you're in the area.  It makes my husband's trips to Fry's Electronics across the street more tolerable for me.  Last time we went, we were seated in a separate building on the other side of the patio.  Was very nice and relatively quiet.  I'm not overly fond of the patio since Baseline is so busy.  I do prefer the Aunt Chilada's on Dreamy Draw-both the food and the atmosphere.  But I'm sure I'll be back to this location again.  Damn computer geeks.

First tried Aunt Chilada's years ago . . . I've been to both locations and think this one is the lesser of the two.  Both locations have great atmosphere and are inviting although this one, less so as well.  I called ahead for reservations just in case and was told they don't take them.  Luckily, it was not very crowded when I showed up so reservations were not needed.  The restaurant however filled up within a half an hour so I'm glad I didn't have to wait for a table.  My dinner guest and I chose to sit in the outside patio area which is very colorful and spacious.  Service was pretty good.  We were greeted relatively quickly although there was a delay in taking our order.  I ordered what I typically order at a Mexican joint in order to compare it to similar dishes elsewhere . . . chille relleno and a tamale.  Sorry to say AC's relleno is average at best . . . it didn't jump my taste buds seeming rather bland and lifeless despite a mildly spicy green sauce.  The tamale was dry and had an unusual taste that was not particularly pleasant or familiar.  The upside was the service.  My dinner guest was an intellectually disabled woman I mentor for Special Olympics . . . she is somewhat child like and believed that her relleno which she also ordered, was "too spicy."  Our waiter graciously replaced it with a milder selection and did NOT charge us for the first dish.  With all the fabulous Mexican eateries in Arizona, I wouldn't waste my time or money with AC.  There is nothing special about it although the other location may have some historical significance.

I made my reservation for the wrong date (yikes) and showed up with a party of six a day early. The restaurant had a wedding and homecoming and they still managed to squeeze us in for a delicious Mexican-American dinner. Our server Anthony could have been a bit more attentive (forgot drink orders twice) but the food was delicious, the price was fair, and the outdoor seating area was clean and lovely. Props to the hostesses (wish I had their names) for getting us in on a busy night. Ole'!

The food is decent, but a word of advice.  Never sit outside if you see ducks out there.  Case and point - I met my ex there for lunch.  The ducks were very active about leaving their droppings on the porch area where we were sitting.  When someone startled one of the ducks, it flew, dropping a bomb on the table next to us.  If you eat inside, it's not so bad.  They really need to do something about the ducks though.

Long long wait for seating and food. We waited for 30 minuets to be seated and then another 45 for food after we ordered. Also needs to be kept in mind we went right in the middle of the JA conference allotted dinner time. The corn chips were not very good, they were chewy and crunchy but not the good crunchy. My food was good but the rest of my family said it was just okay.  Did not try the salsa, neither my family nor I like salsa. For you want to eat here make sure you have time to spare

EVERY visit here has been phenomenal. The food is always fresh and tastes great. Adult beverages are worth ordering two. A couple of the servers could benefit from some additional training, but other than that I highly recommend this place. Btw EVERYONE I've recommended this place to Love's it just as much as I do. And having eaten at various Mexican restaurants across the US this one is in my top 5.

The staff was friendly.  The food was okay.  Salsa was acceptable.  We sat in the dining room across the courtyard, which is what really ruined the meal.   It was difficult to enjoy anything in a room with such an over powering smell of mildew.

I do not understand the very low reviews that have been posted. Pleasantly spiced food, very good service and a nice atmosphere. It did have a definite resort feel to it, and there is a resort next door. This is probably the reason some of the prices are up where they are.  Okay, the bathrooms were small for this size of a restaurant. Tiny, in fact. The men's room had a tight stall and a small urinal. The ladies' room was of a similar size, I'm told.  Tables - no booths.  So far, some of the better Mexican food we've found in Phoenix.  No lunch menu or specials offered, or we'd give it another star.

This place is awesome! If you're looking for fresh, authentic Mexican food, you will find it here! Friendly and attentive as well. Homemade salsa and chips are served complimentary when you first arrive. We also ordered guacamole, which was delicious, and my husband and I shared the molcajete which is an entree made for two. Comes with carne asada, chicken, and shrimp cooked in an amazing sauce with outstanding flavors. Tortillas and two sides are also served the with meal. Prices are reasonable too. We will be back!!
Hit this place up for a quick happy hour meal. Had to have the enchiladas, they were a little dry. Parking may be an issue if this place was busier.

This would be good mexican food if we were in Quebec someplace... maybe I shouldn't say that, maybe they have quite good Mexican food in Canada...  But we have excellent Mexican food here in the Valley of the Sun.  Many five star locations.  More than any other location outside Mexico (and probably more than many a location inside Mexico)...  This spot is not one of them.   As the other reviewer stated, a pretty good happy hour, which is why it gets two stars, cause let's face it, a good happy hour can really set up your whole evening.  The food is not good.
This place has great food...but I particularly enjoy the outside patio atmosphere...I give the margaritas 2 thumbs up

Was looking forward to authentic Mexican food... The Guacamole was fresh out of a package topped with pre-shredded generic cheese and black olives fresh from a can. Fresh avocados are not hard to come by right now. Veggies on the side were right out of the freezer. Also the bar had a line and only one bartender for the entire restaurant. They might soon be on an episode of Restaurant Impossible if it weren't for the ever changing customer base that comes from the Arizona Grand and other surrounding resorts.

Over priced, awful margaritas and hands down the worst chips & salsa in Phoenix. I have to wonder about the people who rated this 3 stars and up. Where are you from and what garbage do you eat at home to think this is passable as Mexican food.

Other than the high prices, this place is awesome! The food was delicious! Everyone that I was with during our experience here said their food was amazing and we will definitely come back for more. Again, however, the prices are a bit steep which is a shame because I know I can order the same meal for $4 to $5 less at other mexican restaurants.
Not good at all.  Average at best.  Table we were sat at was sticky and needed wiping down, had to ask the server twice to do it.  Food was ok but not good.

The patio here is so cute and fun! It was to cold to sit outside but the inside was cozy. We had to wait awhile to be seated and after waiting, the bartender finally came over to seat us. The lunch specials are a great value at $7.95. I had the taco and enchilada combo, it comes with refried beans and fideo. I got the spinach con queso inside my enchilada and it was really tasty but everything else was  average mexican food. I think the chips and salsa were the best part. They are great because you get both corn and flour tortilla chips with pico de gallo and hotter sauce. Our waitress didn't come by very often and the service was pretty slow. If I were to go here again I would definitely sit out on the patio and do chips/salsa with a frosty drink.

I was surprised to see the three stars on yelp considering how busy this place is, but three stars is right on the mark.     When I saw the sizzling molcajete on the menu, no reviews from previous diners would have stopped me. But when we arrived at 8:00 pm on a holiday weekend Sunday, the restaurant was less than half full after their rush hour. We thought we would be seated immediately, but us and three other parties ahead of us waited 45 min.   It immediately became apparent that the restaurant is poorly managed and understaffed, at least it is at 8:00pm. Although the servers and hostess were friendly and did what they could, the place was a disaster.  It appeared as though they hadn't staffed the restaurant appropriately for the holiday, or they let servers go home after the dinner rush.   The waiting area had dirty chips and salsa bowls everywhere and looked like no one had cleaned or picked up plates all night.   We waited patiently for 45 min for a table for 2 after they told us the wait was 25 min. Service was ok from our server. But the sizzling molcajete, which is one of their specialties, was not only not sizzling, it was cold in parts. Big disappointment.   I'm sure there is something that is good to eat here considering the huge crowds. Be sure you get a reservation otherwise the wait will be over an hour for dinner.

our server was Jonathan asked for the enchiladas de harina and much to my surprise i recieved a big burrito on the table-i told him i ordered the enchiladas and he said " this is what u ordered its in a tortilla-i didnt eat much of it at the time because i got full on chips and salsa-when i got home the next day i was surprised that the whole "enchilada " was a bunch of shredded beef not the 3 combo enchiladas that was supposed to be one cheese one chicken and ONE beef i ordered so in other words i recieved the wrong item-very disapointed in john

5 star service for our server, Summer. The food was amazing albeit a little expensive for what you actually get. Disappointing, yet understandable because they are part of a resort. But everything went well and she was very patient with me. I was #BeyondObsessed with both the house guacamole and the regular guacamole, as I said the food was AMAZE! so I left her a $5 tip (I was dining alone) I can't wait to bring a friend with me the next time I'm near Arizona Grand Resort

I'm looking at this place as a forty year citizen of San Antonio, Texas the Tex/Mex food capital of the US. Jordan was our server and she did a good job considering.      Their Fajitas were terrible with a stale taste and they seemed rubbery. They showed up in the proper iron heating plate but it was set for Nuc so most of the veggies and chicken were blackened. The chips were nice and thick but their salsa was weird. I ordered corn tortillas but hard and dry flour ones appeared, but the butter never arrived. The pork in the giant enchilada was fatty and poor quality. The Charro beans and the rice were good. I returned the Fajitas and ordered two beef soft tacos on corn tortillas and these were fine.    The frozen Margaritas were potent but tasted unusual. It's a hoot trying to get to this place with Baseline a traffic jungle.

The only thing going for it was that it was wide open, they put us in the corner of the courtyard and it was good for the children to run around.   The food was terrible. Even the salsa was not good. The chips were decent, thin and crispy.  I got the cheese dip, just ok. My wife's combo of chicken flauta and taco was not good. Even the rice and beans were not that good.  What do I expect from a resort restaurant. Should've known better... but it is convenient if you're staying at the Arizona Grand resort and have a very large group.  Not only that... that charge 20% gratuity for large groups!

Food and service good but VERY pricey especially for lunch. A simple cheese quesadilla was 7.50 and to top it a small scoop of sour cream in a little taco shell was an additional 2.50!  Probably wont go there again too expensive when you can go to others for much larger portions and free side of sour cream.
We frequent the squaw peak location - but tried this location when in the area.  Portions are smaller, menu is pretty different, prices higher.  We prefer the other location.

Pretty high prices for below average Mexican food. Just to give you an idea: Chipotle is be better tasting! Lol! Perfect place to grab a drink and an appetizer and sit at the patio- chips and salsa were good. Then have your main curse somewhere else. We went there for lack of restaurants at a walking distance from the Arizona Grand Resort. The patio and ambiance were nice and the weather was perfect to sit outside. Service was good. We ordered a small guacamole. The avocados were ripe, but the guacamole had no flavor and it had awkwardly a bit of shredded cheese on top. We kept adding salsa, limes and salt to add flavor to the guacamole. My friend ordered fish tacos. Parts of the fish were burnt. My other friend and I ordered a combo of enchilada with a chile relleno. Half of the plate was covered with melted yellow and white cheese. After finding the chile relleno and enchilada under the melted cheese they were ok. Asked for tortillas and charged us extra each without letting us know for chewy tortillas. The amounts of food are large, that's for sure. The side of Fideo was not very good. I don't mind paying 30-40 dollars for good food, but this felt as money not well spent.

Took a client here to lunch today.   Service was good. Waitress was friendly and nice. Very responsive.   Food was great. I love their jalapeño cream sauce. Not sure what is with all the negative reviews, I have nothing but good experiences here. Not super authentic, but not too fake. Sits in the middle.   Beautiful property, especially the patio.

Just stopped by for a bite to eat at this place. Stood at hostess stand for 10 minutes.  Chef walked by. A waitress walked by.  Neither helped us. Decided to take our money somewhere it would be appreciated.

Haven't been here in almost 20 years, thought I'd give it a second try. Wish I hadn't. It took forever for the food to come out, and the salsa tasted like ketchup. Our server was nice. When the food finally came out, they forgot components of some of the dishes. Street tacos were boring - had better tacos at any of the 'bertos. My buddy had the fajitas and he said the chicken was so dry and tasteless he couldn't even eat it. To boot, it was way overpriced, probably because they are connected to the Arizona Grand resort. Half my party got sick later that night. Horrible experience, and not much has changed in 20 years.

A must go location for visitors.  Squaw Peak location is very memorable.  The food is good.  When I worked nearby, I ate there frequently!  Recently took my Father for his birthday and the memorabilia is neat (Squaw Peak).  The Tempe location is easy to get to and has the same great food.  Fundido is fun ;)
Delicious lunch shared here with my mom who is visiting  from. Canada. She said it was the best!

I truly am not trying to be mean but this waitress is bad for business at least by my standards. She is older with an unkept appearance and somewhat spits out everything she says. She may be efficient but Her unkempt appearance made it difficult for us to enjoy our meal. If a waitress does not appear clean, hair combed back neatly, it is not easy to enjoy your meal.

Aunt Chilada's is a pretty standard American Mexican place. The food was pretty basic and no frills. I would not get the quest dip because it looked and tasted like cheese whiz. My enchiladas were warm but lacked flavor as did the beans and rice it was served with. The only part I would consider getting again was the fried ice cream.

Much better than the North Phoenix location. The menus are different. The food is very good for the type restaurant. I really love their fish dish but it seems to be only on certain menus. The service is spotty but friendly. The patio is nice as is the room across from it.

Sat in the patio (soaking up the nice AZ weather)....  We had a retirement lunch here.  It was roomy and we can be noisy!  :)  The chips were good and crispy.  I got the chicken chimy, it was ok.  Almost flavorless.  I so wanted to LOVE this place but the food was just not that good.  The staff was nice!

Recently discovered that the refried beans and green tomatillo sauce are not vegetarian! Refried beans are made with lard, and tomatillo sauce has a chicken stock base. Extremely disheartening but the food is still great!  Black beans are veggie friendly, and if you're looking for an additional side, they have roasted vegetables.

Probably the worst Mexican food of all time.  They do have good Cadillac margaritas but that the only reason I would give them a star.  The food was absolutely horrible.  I do not even want to go into detail about why it was so bad.

If this is the best Mexican in Phoenix (per the Arizona Grand resort), then I think Phoenix has a serious problem. Holy crap was that some greasy, bland mexican food.  Taco bell kicks the hell out of this place. Ceviche was inedible - pretty sure it was days old. Meat in fajitas must have been dredged in flour and totally overcooked. Everything was bland, and just BAD.

Aunt Chilada's at the Pointe is more about atmosphere than food.  It has a good happy hour, but the food is pretty pedestrian.  I was forced to edit and downgrade my rating because of my most recent visit.  Though the service was quite good, the food was horrific.   Was there again recently with some folks from work. It was chosen since it was close to the hotel our corporate visitors were staying. I decided to forgo the usual safe burro and try the chile relleno and the spinach enchilada. O...M...G...what a mistake.  The spinach enchilada consisted of a limp tortilla filled with frozen spinach and covered in a sauce that if it wasn't from a can was seasoned with tin...ha...ha. The relleno was stuffed with queso, breaded, deepfried, covered with the same tin flavored sauce, which in turn was then covered again with rubbery white cheese. Oh boy!  What a treat!  After this meal I have made a vow to never to stray from a burro here again.   So, if you plan on getting together with a big group for Happy Hour, Aunt Chilada's is an OK choice.  If you are looking for truly top flight Mexican food, there are other places that may be more appropriate.
We ordered food to go and it was horrible! Pollo fundido was cold and just tasted like chicken with sour cream.. green chili burrito was very soggy. We were very disappointed and won't be back again.
The Sizzling Molcajete was delicious and huge! If I was a local I would definitely be a repeat customer. Yum!

The food was terrible and super expensive. Service is horrible and overall terrible experience.    Came here for dinner and it couldn't have been worse. Everything was horrible tasting and super expensive. The asada salad I ordered was worse than the salad you get at McDonald's, and it cost a whopping $15. The service was non existent, we never saw our waitress ever! drinks not refilled at all.     Avoid!!

I'm AMAZED this restaurant does NOT have at least 4 stars! I did not take time to read the feedback but I can tell you the food is very good and the service is as well. I had a spinach enchilada and my friend had the shredded beef enchilada.   The selections on the menu were plentiful. The atmosphere was pleasant- enough said
Worst margaritas and rudest bartender I've ever experienced. 2 stars are for good salsa and average Mexican food...

A very large group of us stopped here for dinner last night. Food was wonderful, staff very friendly but service slow. Chris was wonderful but obviously understaffed. Not his fault. Would come back again in a heartbeat. Outside dining area was perfect. Nice patio heaters to keep us comfy. Food plentiful and tasty.

Service was pretty good, however they have Pepsi, boohoo! Salsa was tasty but the chips were stale. They ambiance was bright, colorful, nice patio...food was a 3 out of 5, however it's a Lil pricey for what you get. One beef taco with rice and beans is $11. Steak fajitas are $17. Would I try this place again? Eh probably not.

We were in Arizona for a short vacation and my one requirement was some good Mexican food (and some sun ). Lol  While laying by the pool we started asking other guests for recommendations. Aunt Chiladas was mentioned.  They mentioned the outdoor patio and the margaritas. I immediately went to Yelp to look at the rating and reviews. Hmmm... 2 1/2 stars,  not something I will generally give a try but it was close and we were hungry.   Upon arrival,  the water feature out front was lovely. We asked for patio seating and it was also lovely. It was a little cool out but no worries because they have plenty of heaters to take the chill away until the margaritas kick in. Lol.  The service is very good. They brought us menus and water and chips and salsa right away and our server took our drink orders giving us time to look the menu over. The El Diablo is the Margarita to order. They have a tequila menu with lots of different tasty brands also. We started with the table side guacamole. Very fresh and worth the extra money to have it made to order.  I always order street tacos any chance I get. There was a choice of meats and I went with the Carne asada, Caritas and chicken tinga. It came with Pico, avocado crema and pickled onions. You can also choose between flour or corn tortillas. They were spectacular. My husband had the Pollo fundido and he said it was very good. They give you a lot of food and I think it was a good value.  We tried 2 other restaurants Macayo's Mexican Depot Cantina and Los Reyes de la Torta  and didn't care for them as much.  In fact we ended up coming back to Aunt Chiladas again our last night in Arizona. I again ordered the street tacos (why try to improve on perfection). My husband ordered a burro and enjoyed it.  I'm not sure why this restaurant only has 2 1/2 stars. It is a nice comfortable restaurant with good service,  great drink selections and awesome food priced appropriately. Give them a chance,  you won't regret it.
Service is a little on the slow end, but the servers are great! So if your in a rush, this is not the place for you. Otherwise, seriously the food and atmosphere is amazing!

Decent food, pleasant wait staff, awful management and 2.5 hour dinner... I'm so disappointed in a dinner we were so looking forward to. We visit Aunt Chilada's several times a year, it's always been a favorite for out of town guests. From the wrong meal being served (and then attempted to be passed over for what she actually ordered... and this wasn't a substitution or special request, but simply an off the menu item...), to nearly twice the original 30 minute wait time to the poor wait staff being so busy there wasn't even to refill our water glasses, this visit was the last for me. I get that every establishment has the occasional bad night, but the last straw came with the manager's beyond lackadaisical and couldn't care less attitude. When management doesn't care how can it be expected that anyone else will? So long, Aunt Chilada's, it been fun.

I decided to try this place while in Tempe, based mostly on reviews on Yelp and another media.  I was greeted by a surly young man who may have awakened on the wrong side of the universe.  I asked for a well-lit area, and he seated me near a window.  Daylight was fast fading, as I was quickly served homemade chips and salsa.  The salsa was uninspired and bland.  The server, Samuel, was prompt and made a couple of recommendations.  I tried the pork fajitas.  By now the sun was down, and when the food arrived, it was so dark at the table, I could barely distinguish the pork from the veggies.  It was good, but I like to be able to see my food.  The candles at the table were sorely inadequate.  I asked Samuel about the lighting, and he said only the manager can change it and he/she had gone home already.  I was the sole diner in that dining room, BTW.  There were others in another part of the restaurant that I could hear, but couldn't see.  I left over half of my meal there, just because I couldn't see any longer what it looked like.  Very disappointing.  I wouldn't return to this restaurant.

The salsa is chunky and delicious! I got fajitas, they were decent and my wife got enchiladas, she got one with green salsa and one with red salsa, she liked the red salsa the best. I didn't have any problems with my refills, the waitress was nice and efficient. We finished our meal with fried ice cream and we all enjoyed it. I would recommend this place.

I've been here numerous times and never had a bad experience.  It is what it is and I like it for that. It's not gourmet, it's not fancy or original probably not even authentic, but it's dependable.  I've always been served HOT decent tasting food. Their salsa isn't  half bad even though its made from canned tomatoes with added fresh cilantro, the chips are great, always hot and fresh.  Their Carnitas are some of my favorite, my husband is  fan of the cheese enchiladas and I also order the fish tacos too(see pic). All these items have been consistently good.  It can get busy with the annoying resort crowd, but if your looking for just plain old generic Mexican food that will fill you up and not rip you off, this is it. Yes I've had better and yes there is better, but like I said before:  It is what it is and I like it for that. It's not gourmet, it's not fancy or original probably not even authentic, but it's dependable. And I've definitely had worse!

I was in such a good mood to write something positive, after all it was 80 degrees, sunny and we were sitting outside on the colorful patio pretending it was summer instead of the 10 degrees we left back home in Minneapolis.  On the positive side our server stopped by our table right away with a huge bowl of crispy chips and two large bowls of salsa. We ordered two patron margaritas that came pretty quickly and were good, although clearly not made with fresh juice.  As for the food, its a bit on the mass market side in terms of taste and flavor and certainly not the authentic Mexican I was hoping for.  Perhaps I've just gotten spoiled by the number of great new places serving fresh exciting Mexican food.  If you have kids and are looking for something mild, then this could be the place.

Oh dear god where do I start?! Oh with the less then stellar waitress I had the displeasure of dealing with! What an epic fail she was, if you can't handle a large party (of 6) then maybe you should let your mgr know and bail before you get in way to deep....as you did Saturday night! Let's start with the drink order...if you can't remember something...write it down...maybe then it wouldnt take 2 people and 3 attempts at getting it right..sprite vodka and grenadine...how you managed to get root beer out of any of that I will never Marsha, I will never know! Then you disappear before we order food! Finally get to order the rest of the drinks for the table (had to send 2 back..tasted awful) and some apps...then you were hard to find once again Marsha! Finally we were able to find you (yes...we went looking)and ordered the food some how from you not writing things down our order got messed up...go figure right?! Not such a great first impression...I'll stick to taco bell for my Mexican food from now on!

This sorry shithole really could only survive in Touristville adjacent to the resort. Good God! I actually felt like my wallet got gang-raped for the experience: one dinner + one quesadilla appetizer + three margaritas = $60. What in the hell is that!? It would be one thing if the food was amazing.... but the so-called green chilis in my quesadilla were cut up raw mild boring jalapenos that added absolutely zero to the food (but cost an extra $2). The poor downtrodden quesadilla soon sweated an enormous pool of grease, which soaked its entire underside, rendering it inedible. One of my friends passed around a guac appetizer, and the raw onions in there would either put hair on your chest or singe it clean off, not sure which. Blech!  I will add a 1/2 star because the margaritas were tasty. Either they used high end tequila, or there was no booze at all in there. For the price, I would hope it was nice tequila. Clearly, since I can't really tell either way, there wasn't much in there. I could also go so far as to add a half star for the ambiance. Total old-school Arizona touristy kitsch, and the patio was very nice for our group gathering. However, with the preponderance of wonderful places with outdoor seating, I doubt the patio alone would ever lure me back. See ya at Los Dos!
Yuck. Other than the great patio, everything else is awful. Food was awful, management was even more terrible. No thanks.
I loved the molcajete! The margarita was really good as well, and it sneaks up on you.. i could barely make it to the car!

I've been a long time fan. My first visit to this place was wayy back when, literally. I had my first Aunt Chilada's experience when I was 8 and my family and I have been visiting ever since then. Not sure why it took me so long to leave a review.  They have one of the biggest tequila selections in Arizona, by far! And if you're a Tequila connoisseur like myself you will appreciate it.  I'm a big fan of their Sunday brunch. They have a great selection at great prices and can really modify a the plates to your liking if you want. If it's a nice day out, I suggest sitting out on the patio. They have umbrellas to shade your area, but it's cute to see the ducks from the pond hanging out and walking around.

My review:  Please understand that I am a hard rater.  I rarely award more than 3 stars.  My definition of 3 stars is a good, solid meal with good service.   The food here was just okay and the prices are high.  The staff was friendly and attentive however my entree arrived 1 minute after my soup arrived.  Poor planning on my servers part.  Tonight I had the three enchilada plate and corn with chorizo soup.  I am not a fan!  I haven't been here in several years.  Now I remember why.

My fiancee and I went here on a date night and it was great! Great atmosphere, great food, delicious chips and salsa before the meal(I was a tad full for my food), and superb service! Will definitely visit again!

Oh my goodness, this is such an Arizona institution. I came here recently while on vacation in Phoenix. It had been at least 10 years since I had good Mexican food. And let's be honest. While this is not totally authentic Mexican it's good old AZ-style Sonoran-American combo plate comfort food. And it's really not that easy to find on the east coast. I grew up on this stuff so the nostalgia factor is huge. Such a pleasure having a chile relleno with frijoles refritos, rice and giant frozen margarita. Ahhhh, watch out for that brain freeze. The chips and salsa could have been a little better, but I ate too many of them as is.

We ate there on a Sunday early dinner.  We sat outside, nice with the Mexican music.  I had three item combo, cheese enchilada, beef taco, bean tostado, the meal was excellent, brought some home.  My husband ordered the chili relino and spinach enchilada with cream sauce, his was also excellent, and he brought some home.  We didn't have a drink but the looked great! Would go back.

Met my parents here for an early dinner on a Saturday.  Cute place, quick service. We enjoyed the 2 types of salsa.  The first is a very chunky mild tomato salsa and the other is smoother by spicier.   We all enjoyed to charro beans but mixed opinions on the fide.  The burros and chimis were well portioned meat to tortilla ratio.  My only complaint is how the street tacos were served- covered in cabbage to the extent that I could not identify which taco was which.  Very difficult to eat and enjoy.   Will be back to try some margaritas!

I don't have a lot of positive comments but no hate either.  I just think it's a tourist trap that has been here for years and gone down hill. It is over priced, and the food is not that great.  The salsa was ok.  I am not super fussy when it comes to Mexican food but I do know good Mexican food.  It sure can be hard to find great Mexican food in Phoenix (of all places).  Explain that to me. The service we had was great, nice young man.  I do not know if because the property surrounding the restaurant has changed hands so frequently, that has had something to do with the quality of food at this place but I remember 20 yrs ago the food was much better.  I would not recommend this place to any friends or out of town guests.  We will not be returning.  The food is boring.

I normally have great things to say about this place. Always ask for flour tortillas chips. Might want to pass on the fideo. It generally has the consistency of spaghetti. Aside from that, the food is usually great. Lots of lower calorie options available.  Today, is not one of the days I have rave reviews. We sat there waiting for 30 minutes after being told it would be a 10 minute wait. They said no tables available. Do they not understand that we can see the patio and half the dining area from the waiting area? We could see 8 open tables in the patio. 5 open tables in the 1st dining area. We passed13 open tables when we were finally called inside.   We waited another 15 minutes at our table before we were even acknowledged by our waitress. She took mine and my husband's drink orders, and ran off to go fill them. That would have been super awesome, except there were 5 of us at the table!!!  We ordered drinks for the rest of our party when she brought our drinks. She brought our food, and then hurried away again. I had to stop her at another table to remind her about drinks for the rest of my table. The drinks were for my children!!   This was honestly the worst restaurant experience I've had in a long time. This used to be one of my favorite places. Now I'm not sure if I would ever recommend this to my out of town guests again. For a restaurant that gets so much resort business, you'd think they'd treat their customers better.

We celebrated Mother's day early. 5 mom's out for dinner with a wonderful waitress named Katie! She was a beautiful spirit, knowledgeable and very attentive to our needs. This waitress is the reason this restaurant is successful. I've lived here in the valley 17 yrs, this was my first visit but not my last. Great food and superb service 5/6/2018 @5pm.

While enjoying our stay-ca at Arizona Grand Resort, we ventured off to Aunt Chilada's for dinner after the water park. We were seated after an average waiting time of 25 minutes. Our appetizers arrive quickly, the street corn was bursting with flavor! Although our actual meal was delayed, the service and compensation for the delay made the experience a positive memory. The entire table partook in the "birthday" dessert. Worth 4+stars

I ordered a one item combo, chicken burro, with rice and fideo. Chicken in the burro is canned for sure..I couldn't eat it, so asked for a cheese enchilada instead. The corn tortilla was hard af, the enchilada sauce was disgusting! If you know how to make Mexican food... This place is not for you.

Queso dip and chips awesome, salsas very good, service was very good. Entrees were good (chile verde burrito and pollo fundido) but not great. Beers were plenty cold. Would go back without hesitation. Nice casual atmosphere.

Authentic Mexican food? I don't so!  I went in on a Tuesday afternoon with a few friends. We were not greeted when we walked in. However, we were seated with in a couple of minutes. One of my friends noticed that the chips were stale so she proceeded to ask for fresh beans. I ordered 2-enchilada dinner with black beans. The tortillas from the enchiladas were tough, I couldn't cut them using only a fork. Enchilada's are supposed to be tender, it really seemed as the tortillas were left out and used the next day. The Black beans were so bland and came out of a can. I ordered a side of guacamole and had to ask the nice server to take it back. It tasted really bad-not fresh at all. I have given two stars for the service. It's not the waiters fault so I can appreciate them.

Large portions so you might consider sharing a meal. We received a complimentary cheese crisp from our hotel. It was delicious but huge for just 2 of us. I had the fish tacos, black beans and fideo. I make my own fideo at home and this was equally as good. My husband ordered the crane asana street tacos and said the meat was great but could only eat 2/3.  I would definitely return when I'm hungrier.

I have gone to this location probably 5 times now and this last time was by far the best service I have had ever! I ordered the Pollo Fundido and it was the bomb! I was stuffed for sure. The free chips and salsa were delicious! To top it off I ordered a sangria margarita and I was blown away but how delicious it was. To end the amazing meal we had fried ice cream that was a trip to heaven! I wish it was not so far away from my house so I could come back again. My only concern was that the food came out so fast that we did not get to eat a ton of chips and salsa or have another round of drinks!

On my grand return to the valley, I was craving Mexican. However, by the time my friends and I got around to eating and stopped chatting, we knew there would be a long line at Los Dos, so we swung by Aunt Chiladas. While it was good, it wasn't fantastic, and I'm not sure I'd do it again.  The first foul was getting there and not realizing the entire front area was a bar/bar seating and not places you can order food (speaking of which, why can't you order food at the bar... ugh). We were then thrown with a 50 minute wait for what seemed like a practically empty parking lot. As starving as we were, we probably ate way more chips than we should have and started in on a pitcher of sangria. By the way, the sangria had no fruit in it.. I think they removed it before they put it in the pitcher. VERY disappointing.   After we were finally allowed to leave the cougar area and head to the main establishment, the food was just meh in my opinion. Interestingly enough when our food came, our waitress brought it out and then just walked away leaving it on the fold out serving tray and not delivering it to our table. The tacos a friend ordered were taunting him horrendously. Mine came with the wrong side dish which meant I had to constantly push it out of the way.   The fried ice cream was good, but not the best I've had.  In the end, this was just a good learning experience...but it was great to be back amongst friends.

Where to start? Tables were unbussed so we had to sit at a dirty one. Wait staff ignored us for 20 minutes until finally a busser decided that he would acknowledge us after the fifth time he walked past. We wanted to leave but had some other folks coming to meet us so we were pretty much locked in and resigned ourselves to waiting. Finally one of the three waitresses in the bar area took pity on us and got our drink order and appetizer. Drinks took another 10 minutes and then we were ignored again for the rest of the hour that it took us to get our check and get out of this sh*thole. Oh but only I could give half a star. :(

The best thing about this restaurant is the waitress Marcia. if it wasn't for her then we would never go back. she is so kind and pleasant and thoughtful and attentive and the list goes on and on. we only go when she's there and we only sit in her section she takes care of all of our needs and more. we love her and we love the food and when she's not there we walk right back out she is their biggest asset and she deserves a raise and a bonus and a plaque on the wall I love Marcia I love this restaurant

Yum and yet a bit of a yawn.  Yes it was a bit of yesterday as I appreciated the decor and the speed of the service.  Nothing stood out much.  The place was clean and made me think of driving a few hours further south for the real deal...and that cannot be bad...right?  To be reminded of the real thing so much that you want to leave where you are and go get the real thing?  Your call...not yuck, though.
Great food and great service.  I enjoyed the enchiladas and the fideo. This place is awesome !!

Great atmosphere.  Outdoor seating is quaint with romantic lighting.  Tableside guacamole is amazing.  The Pollo Fundido did not disappoint and my taste buds highly recommend pairing your meal with the Fideo and Charro beans.  I've also had the opportunity to taste the Steak Tampiquena and I find it very typical for Mexican restaurants to prepare their skirt steak in a manner that does not break down the connective tissues.  The taste was as expected, marvelous.  Of course the staff was awesome and very attentive.
The food wasn't bad, but I have definitely had better.  The outside atmosphere was very nice, the staff was also very friendly.  I'd go back but it isn't what i'm accustomed too.

Well after having this place hyped up on our drive in I was very excited to go there my very first evening in town.  My wife, two friends, and I wandered over and were met with a 20 minute wait which I thought was a good sign.  My wife and one friend ordered specials while the other two of us ordered the three taco meal. The score ended up with the specials winning but the tacos did not. My tacos were LUKE warm and very dry like they had been sitting too long. The double stacked corn tortillas couldn't hold up and fell apart.  Extraordinarily disappointed.  Having been a westerner and now an easterner I was looking forward to really good Mexican. This didn't get me there.

Location: Right off Baseline Road. Across from Fry's Electronic Store  Atmosphere: Not bad..has a nice little front room and seemed clean  Food: Absolutely horrible. The food was smothered in sauce which worries me because I feel they do this to cover up something and it did...flavor.  We ordered the "Special" which I feel would have been the best to try...it was very salty and had little overall flavor. The cheese crisp appetizer was pretty much a tortilla smothered in tons of oily cheese. was completely upset and will never go back again.  Recommend: Absolutely not. I felt Taco Bell has more authenticity than this place. I hate to say that but it was a complete waste of money.

I was staying at The Arizona Grand for 4th of July and had dinner since its located really close by. The food was really good with big portions. There was 3 of us so we opted for the pitcher of sangria which I highly recommend!

I've been here many times. Mostly with business associates.  The food is good but average for an Americanized Mexican Food place. I've never had anything bad here. Every, but it's not worth the drive from my home.  If your close by, it is better than other places nearby. You do get plenty of food for the money and it is satisfying.

My friend suggested we celebrate my friend's birthday here.  What a mistake.  The table was akward for 8 people to see each other but hey, we didn't make a reservation. The sad part is that two of us ordered the fajitas (including the birthday gal).  The food arrived and sat next tto our table for well over 5-minutes.  By the time the waitress came to serve our food, it was cold (although we commented on how when the fajitas had first arrived they were not making a sizzling sound).   The waitress appeared upset that we were wanting our food at least worm vs. cold.  She took it to the kitchen and brough back fajitas that had been stuck in the over.  Food was HOT but now way overcooked.  I wont' be returning  to this place anytime soon -- with some many other great choices, i'm sorry my friedn chose this restaurant.

Aunt Chilada's had some good things going for it and some not so good things going for it. I really enjoyed the ambiance of the restaurant and loved how the dining rooms were in separate little buildings and how the courtyard was beautifully lit, it added an air of intimacy to the restaurant.   We didn't have an appetizers, we noshed on the awesome portion of chips and salsa we were served, very yummy! For my meal I ordered the veggie enchiladas and a raspberry margarita (they were out of pomegranate for shame!). The enchiladas were not great at all and totally fell apart as I was eating them. Definitely worth the loss of a star or two. The margarita on the other hand was supremely delicious and it was not long before I'd drank it up.   If I'm ever in Tempe again I don't think Aunt Chilada's would be my first pick but overall it's an okay joint.

I was pleasantly surprised by aunt chilada's. I usually steer clear of restaurants that my fellow yelpers rate so low. However, it was my friend's birthday and this is where she choose. I started out with a rum runner that was very much on the pricy side, $9. It was strong, I wasn't expecting to get half my money's worth but I definitely did.  The chips were brought out quickly and I was given a mild salsa and a spicy salsa. They were both really good. That's always my favorite part of Mexican restaurants.  I'm not always a fan of Mexican food unless it's authentic. Most places, are too Tex mex for my liking. I ordered the special, a 6 oz steak with a cheese enchilada, black beans, and rice. I ate it all. It could have been the rum runner, but this was by far one of the best Mexican places I've eaten at.  They also brought out a free birthday dessert with a candle that was delicious and big enough to share. The service was good, but it's a bit too pricy for what you get. I think because  it's so close to the Arizona grande resort they price gouge. We didn't have reservations, but it was only two of us. It looked big enough to accommodate big groups and had many tables. The patio tables look lovely when if starts to cool downs.

My Husband went in for a quick lunch and while he had been here before I had not.  The food was good but our waitress Beverly was a very delightful woman.  She kept our drinks full the entire time, always had a smile on her face and just an all around pleasant woman to talk too.  I think she said that she had been there for 18 years don't quote me on that though.  She made our visit a great experience and we may just go back in the future.

Pass by this place daily and decided to give it a try one afternoon for lunch. Not sure why they don't have a higher rating. We were not seated promptly, and it wasn't super busy doing the week, so I don't know know what the delay was.  Fajitas, a chimichanga and two margaritas became our lunch. The dishes both came with well seasoned and rice and the chimi also came with black beans.  The chips and salsa brought before the entrées included both a spicy and chunky type. Both were awesome.   Wait staff was professional and had no issues. Food and drinks came out as ordered and was great.

Como se dice "meh"? Aunt Chilada's sucks mucho. Lets start with a very average margarita for $12, an $11 Mojito made with a mix, and chips with a salsa that could call  any supermarket aisle home. Entrees are way over priced for a very mediocre offering.  I always clean off my plate, seriously concerned with the plight of starving children in third world countries, but on this day even that thought couldn't get me to finish. The tortillas were horrible, how the hell do you screw up a tortilla? Service was also sub par, bordering on rude. Never again, or as the say in Mexico, nunca mas.

This place is horrible!!  A full tourist trap.  Went there after golf today to wait for traffic to ease up. Sat at the disgusting, old, dingy bar. (Bathrooms are worse). We order the chicken chimichanga.  HORRIBLE!!!  How you make Mexican food tasteless is a mystery but they did it.  Worst Mexican food I've ever had, hands down. Taco Bell is better.  Service was horrible.  How this place stays open is beyond me .... actually, I'm guessing the only people that go are staying at the resort.  Suckers.  The place needs to be bulldozed.

Aunt Chilada's it is time to hang up the towel..reinvent yourself as a nursing home cafeteria and everyone will be happy.   Your nachos are, well Auntie -they're nasty. The cheese is stringy, the chips stale and the chicken tastes canned..The worst part is all you put on nachos is cheese, beans and chicken - no salsa, no guac, no olives, no onions...Alot of nots.  The hair that was impaled in the cheese is actually not what stopped me from eating...the lack of taste is was haulted me, the hair just confirmed the decision for me.    The margaritas are $8.00 which silly me, made me think that, here in  the land of the sun, where everyone serves margaritas as cheaply as possible, for $8 I must be getting something really special. No, I was wrong.  Nothing special about your cheap tasting tequila and even cheaper mix that is shot off the bartender's gun in a standard pint glass for $8...seriously? 16oz of Mrs. T's and a shot of tequila or rubbing alchohol, everything had the taste of shortcuts at Aunties.   Your bathrooms are dirty and really you have the resort golf crowd not a bunch of rowdies, so its' not them, its you not checking on the faciities throughout the night. And, given that I am paying $8 for margies and $12 for some stale chips, a clean bathroom would have been a nice touch.   Your staff is quite nice and you have plenty of them. So, though you were serving me crap and ripping me off while you were doing it, you were really nice about it. I didn't boher to complain about the hair because if I started with the hair, were would my complaint have ended...again, retirement is the key.   So, Auntie, your mexican restaurant days should be coming to a close. Maybe lay off the booze and consider a buffet style generic mexican food in a nice assisted living facility. This would be your true calling but selling overpriced generic, crap tasting mexican food at the foot of a resort needs to come to a stop - someone is going to get hurt.
It was nice to sit outside in the spring time. It's pretty quaint. The chips and salsa were good. The food was decent. The burrito was good and was big.

Surprised this only has 2.5 stars. Clean. Sweet ambience with a fountain feature and great patio. Our server was VERY sweet, attentive and prompt. Our whole family thought it was delicious. I had the street tacos-mahi, carnitas and carne asada-the marinade was amazing on all 3, tortillas hand made and ingredients were fresh. My husband and sister in law had the chimichanga and devoured it, mother in law loved the chicken tortilla soup. We ordered sopas for dessert, and they are made fresh and hot so they accommodated my request to leave off the cinnamon & sugar.  Overall food and service were fantastic. I left off one star only because the prices are higher than most Mexican places, but the portions were HUGE, and my street tacos had a ton of meat on each one.

As far as Mexican food goes, this wasn't the best that I have ever had.  However if you work in the area, it is a good destination for clients or family that are in town shopping at Mill, this should be a viable option.  The food is what I would classify as MexiCali.  Definitely not the home raised Mexican food from Tucson.  Give it a shot, Yelp me back and tell me how it was.

We had heard that Aunt Chilada's was a great place for Mexican food and decided to give it a try.  It was close to 1PM.  The small dining area next to the hostess was empty and I asked if we could sit there.  Hostess said no but would seat us in the main dining room.  That place was packed.  It was not only packed it was extremely noisy.  There were three groups and individual tables were placed between them.  Oh my!  What an awful environment.  We waited for a while and no server arrived.  So, we checked out the lunch menu.   Nothing about this menu was inexpensive.  It was pretty pricey for lunch.  The single taco plate was $10.99.  We sat there debating whether to stay or leave.  Our server hadn't arrived yet and too many negatives were already coming up about this place --- loud, expensive and slow service is what we were seeing.  No thanks.  We went down the road and had a great lunch.
I really don't like aunt enchiladas not very good food. I don't see what the big deal is.

Maybe it was because I was starving... I liked the food.  We were at the Pointe for a trade show and this is where we ended up for lunch.  We had no wait and the food was really good, I got a shredded beef cheese crisp and my coworker got the chimi plate.  The chips and salsa were good.  Only issue I had was my empty ice tea glass, I finally had to ask for more when our bill was delivered.

This place is on my regular lunch rotation when meeting friends.  I usually get the Aunt Chilada's Special which is a green chili chimichanga, or the tacos pescado (fish tacos).  It is the only place I have ever had fedeo which is a Mexican spaghetti.    I like the food, and more importantly, my Chicana wife likes the food and she is picky about Mexican food.  This is not the cheapest place for good Mexican food, but it is a fun place to meet with friends.
