It has been awhile since I have been to Aunt Chiladas....and what a disappointment!  Went with a large group, we had horible service.  We were not brought refills, the food came very slowly.  We had to go track down our server and a manager to request service.   Seems like since they were getting an automatic 20% tip because we were a large group she must have gone on break or something.    Food was very greasy, had oil ladden calabasita and a shredded beaf greasy taco.     The group I was with was a lot of fun....but the food was not good, and teh service horrible.  Next time the group meets it will not be at this place.

Mexican food is always a good idea. Considering this is suppose to be a part of the resort the prices were average not high. The food was good. I didnt find the guacamole to be that good like I saw in the reviews. Chips were bland ( i like salted chips) and salsa was ok. But they were free so...
Not even worth my time to write a full review. Chicken is very dry, prices are high, service is terrible, and they got rid of the flower tortilla chips. Stay away.
I did not enjoy this place it was a huge disappointment!!  I rode give zero stars but they force you in order to post a review.  I do not  recommend unless you like giving your money away

I had the 5 shrimp on the skewers and it was delicious.  I like animals and wildlife so I thought it was cute that ducks were swimming in the outside fountain and also walk around the patio in case someone wants to throw them a chip but you may want to sit inside which we did since it was a work dinner. My co-worker had the chicken fundido which she really liked too. The hostess is friendly.

Saw this place on Yelp so thought I would give it a try, sorry I did. The salsa is one of the worst I have ever tried. People in the rest of my party were also very displeased with their entrees to say the least. Ordered a cocktail, which the waitress just raved about, why I don't know. Was basically a kool-aide drink in a cocktail glass. But here lies my biggest problem. Started with the guacamole, chips and salsa. Not the best but eatable. Here comes my entree, OMG. I thought I was going to die! Literally! Two bites or so and I start feeling queasy. And I mean this crap won't stop. So I take a trip to the rest room and figure I will let it pass. But my stomach says different. I started throwing up there proceeded to come home and couldn't stop until every little thing I had eaten at that God forsaken place was out of my system. Will I try it again? I say not. When I told the waitress about the incident she was very nice and quite apologetic. The other women that was called over never introduced herself and was quite rude. Offered to take it off my bill and that was that. By the way I ordered plate # 2 with a green tamale al a cart. I still feel queasy just thinking about it. Good thing there were no great smells or aromas or I probably would not be able to eat this combo any where else either. And to think I went there with such great expectations. I wish that woman, whom ever she may be, would have been courteous. Then maybe I might think of giving them another, try not. Lol.
Wonderful restaurant great location. Good atmosphere with candlelit table. Wonderful waitress. The food and the Margaritas are to die for. Certainly rated this as our favorite. Thank you

Don't waste your money on this place.  It is grossly overpriced mediocre food.  This is not authentic Mexican food more like Americanized Mexican food gone wrong. The chicken enchilada were made of some shredded chicken mixed an odd tomato sauce/seasoning. It was NOT good and the portions were too small for  the price. The fideo that came with the enchiladas was a disaster.    I will say that the kids menu portions were huge.  A really large taco and a really big bean burro were the best deal there.  The kids price was definitely cheap considering the size.  We didn't have any alcohol so I can't comment on that but either way stay away from  this place it's not worth your money.  We ordered a fajita plate, two enchilada plates, two kids meals, and 5 sodas and our check was almost $ 90. Considering food was NOT good this was a waste of money. Our server was very nice though.

Food is fantastic delicious fresh and authentic Marcia is a great server she help us choose our dishes. I had the aunt chilada what a dish flavor are right on target just enough spice beef melting in your mouth and the tacos super delicious with fresh crispy cabbage and sweet and tangy  this was a perfect combination and I do not even talk about the fried burrito if you stay in Phoenix you have to try!!!!! We will be back

Still like the one off of Dreamy Draw Dr. near Squaw Peak. This is the second time I've been here and the food just isn't as good. We also had the unfortunate luck of showing up right after a couple big groups so our service suffered as well.   Floors and tables were less than clean. Not disgusting but you would assume they must have been short staffed and that's why; benefit of the doubt.   I did my trademark chicken enchilada which was pretty dry and Jen did some dish with chicken stuffed in poblano peppers. She liked it a lot. I also need to give kudos for offering to swap our the standard sides of beans and rice for one of their soups. Very cool.   Overall was less than impressed and I guess I'm stuck making the 30 min drive to the good Aunt Chelada's versus the five minute one to this location.
Ordered the tortilla soup and it was very good.  Hubby went with caso appetizer and added chorizo. Very good also. Ordered chimichangas and enjoyed those too. Overall a good value for the experience

Went with a small group for a weekday lunch.  Server was very friendly and prompt with drinks and chips but didn't come back to take our orders for a very long time.  I had a chicken chimi, it was all white meat and plenty of it and it was HUGE.  Decent place for lunch.

The food was good the beverages were goid but the service was terrible.  The waitress we has was snobby and stand offish.  When I asked about a dish or drink she said. "I don't know"  and that's it.  So the food and drinks get 5 starts but the service gets 1 star

My favorite "Mexican" in Phoenix.... If you are planning a lunch trip, be sure to get there early (before 11:30) or you will be in for a wait - but it is well worth it.  I LOVE their salsa & chips, the best anywhere IMO and they also offer a 'hot' version that you can mix in to taste.  I am a fan of 'hot' foods with a bit of pep to them and Aunt Chilada's delivers on specific dishes (ie there is plenty of other offerings if spicy is not your style). The 'Aunt Chilada Special' is my favorite - a cubed, spicy beef filled enchilada covered with both red and green sauces, topped off with cheese and sour cream, served with a choice of sides (I normally go with rice and 'fidao' (sp) - kinda "Mexican spagetti".  I have been eating here for many years as do many people I know, there IS a reason it is always packed - Highly recommended.  There is seating both inside and outside, so depending upon the weather and your personal taste you can do either.

This place is average. The place is really nice inside, but the food is just alright. Pricing is fair for what they serve. The desert it's pretty good with limited options tho. Our server was fine, but she never came back to check in on us. lol

First time experiencing this place was April 22 for a special event. We were seated on the patio. Beautiful outdoor setting, but our location was in direct sunlight. They did place a few umbrellas around which helped some. Had 3 options to choose from; Chimichanga, Enchiladas or a Creamy Chicken Fundito. I went with that. The Jalapeño Cream sauce was delicious but unfortunately my chicken was extremely dry. At the end of our meal we were served beautiful desserts. A chocolate cake & flan. Both were good. Chocolate Cake wonderfully rich &  The Flan was light & appropriately caramelized. Service was great for such a large party. We had about 3 servers assisting our table. Will come back again and explore more of the menu.

This review is for the incredible service of our waitress, Katie! Katie was absolutely phenomenal, and made our dinner such a wonderful experience. Katie was so friendly with a smile and cheerful attitude, and truly showed she loves her job! She was attentive, kind, and defines the kind of customer service people dream about. Management: Please give Katie a pat on the back because she truly is an asset to your business!

It's been awhile since we've dined here. The only gripe I have is the price has gone up significantly on their entrees. None the less I always enjoy their shredded beef with chimichanga, burritos, etc. they have been consistent on the taste. The shredded beef is like dried meat & usually other Mexican food shredded beef are greasy or too much Ah Jus & they kill it with salt properties.

Disappointed to see the bad reviews, because this place is really good. Still one of my favorite Mexican places in Phoenix. I've been dining here for 6 years, since it's down the street from our office, and it's still a great place to go for a quick lunch or after work cocktails.   The service here is friendly, attentive and quick. I made a reservation for lunchtime for a party of 8 and we were in and out of there in under an hour! The food was served hot and delicious. And the best part was they treated our co-worker with a birthday cake, which we laughed at, because the lunch was set up because he was leaving our company. We had played along anyway and he enjoyed his delicious flan birthday treat.   I've tried many dishes here and they are all so good. The pollo fundido is delicious and the burritos will last you for days because they are huge portions. But my favorite part of the dish is the pinto beans and rice. So good! And the nachos are always served hot and the most flavorful salsa in town.   It's not in the most desirable locations, but well worth a visit if your in the South Mountain area.   The outdoor patio is not the best, I'll have to agree. The seats are pretty low and there seems to be birds feeding from the berries in the trees, because we would constantly get hit by a berry and at one point a bird pooped on our menu. So try to get a seat in the patio away from the entrance and the large tree sitting there. But on a beautiful spring day, it's the perfect place to be to watch the sunset and enjoy a margarita!

I've eaten at this restaurant several years ago and thoroughly enjoyed it, so I was quite disappointed in the drink (don't think it had a drop of the patron in it) and the food as it was fairly bland.  The waitress was rushing us out so much as to picking up our chips and salsa and almost our unfinished drink glasses while we are still sitting at the table.  I can honestly say it will be a long time before I consider this restaurant any time soon.
Our service was amazing. John took excellent care of our party of 3. The food was hot and delicious. Highly recommended.
Very basic Americanized Mexican food for the family. Chips were stale, salsa was bland. Food was fine. Nothing wrong with it technically but it's like a Mexican chain restaurant.

I'll keep this one short.   Bad.   Service was painfully slow and pretty negligent. We never even got refills on our water. The food was bland, I've had better from (insert ANY americanized Mexican food restaurant here).   It's a shame because they are in a great location and have an amazing patio. I would never recommend for anyone to come here.
Amazing. I loved every bite. Our waitress was extremely friendly.my wife wants to travel back to the resort just for aunt cheladas.

My husband and I went once and both didn't like our food. About a year later we went back thinking we would give them another chance, and same situation. Food was gross. Too bad because it's a great location.

So having tried this before I went back for lunch. Beat the rush but it still took 30 mins to get the order. Nice service but over priced for what showed up from the kitchen. Salsas were fair but nothing special. Sadly the relleno was flavorless and the black beans also. Other order was a SW chicken caesar. The waitress asked if having it tossed was okay but when it came it had only had dressing in a big glop in the bottom of the bowl. For $10 it was pretty small and a salad only costs about $1.00 at most w/o chicken... which was well grilled and tasty but the cheese added was pretty bland as well. Sorry but will choose another Mexican restaurant in the future.
The soup was bland, the chips were soaked in oil, the salsa tasted sour. I will not go back. The waitress spoke little english and talked too fast to understand her.

Had the opportunity to eat here during the weekend celebration of one of my best friend's birthday.  We were staying in Tempe as we were also attending the Arizona Jazz Festival.  In a word the customer experience was substandard.  "Joseph" the waiter was not particularly friendly or responsive...Whatever caused his bad day should not have impacted the service provided.  The food was not good at all....two of us had chicken enchiladas...dry, tasteless, with a smear of sauce...black beans and rice had no seasoning at all...so bland.  I asked for more sauce for my enchilada and the server never brought it...apologize for forgetting...although I did see him quickly fulfill the request of a neighboring table for guacamole.  Two things were okay with this experience...the little bridge walkway from the parking lot was great for pictures and when I went to the bar to get surprise Patron shots for us...the bartender was a bit more friendly....Although "Joseph" did condescendingly let me know..."you do know that I can get your drink orders'...in which I wanted to say "Yes...I've been to many restaurants and remember how it works and you would be required to have checked back often enough for me to to have place my order with you".   I will not go back or recommend that anyone go there either.

Overall this place was just ok. Went on a Sunday afternoon, I guess it was slow service so they were seating everyone in this small room and the tables were so close together it was very uncomfortable and loud. Our server was nice but the service was not anything special. The pricing is expensive but they give u large portions. For example  The nachos on the appetizer menu is $16.95 but it feeds 4 people. Pina Colada was $9 and not very good. It was all ice and I did not taste one ounce of alcohol. I did not like the chips as salsa...the salsa was a little bland. The patio looks interesting and I could see it being a nice atmosphere in the evening.

Just went to Aunt Chilada's yesterday while staying at the Arizona Grand and it was a great experience. Although there were plenty of tables inside and outside that were available when we arrived, but we waited for nearly half an hour to be seated. But at least they had a waiting area with chips and salsa for us to eat while we waited. Once we finally were seated though the service was really good and we had a very nice waiter. The scenery outside was very cool and i loved all of the colored tables, chairs, etc. There also were a family of ducks that were just walking around outside that the employees told us were always there. Before we ordered food we were brought chips and salsa that you could tell was freshly made that I very much enjoyed. I ordered an shredded chicken enchilada and it can with a side of rice and refried beans. It was very good and very filling. They give you a very decent amount of food for what you pay. But overall I would recommend this restaurant and the overall experience.

It's been a long time since I've eaten at Aunt Chilada's. I get out to the east side very infrequently, but we were in the area and decided to stop in for lunch. I liked the pond with the ducks out front. When we first walked in, I was hit with the smell of toilet water, like the floors had been mopped with dirty water. Not very appetizing. Fortunately the hostess walked us out across the patio to a different building. It smelled more like food over there so that was a good sign. After we were seated, we waited for quite some time before anyone came to greet us, take our drink order, or bring chips & salsa. We were actually contemplating leaving right before our server walked by and said she'd be right with us. When she came to get our drink order, we also ordered our food since we'd had plenty of time to decide. I went with the chicken enchilada, black beans, and rice. The bowl of chips and bowl of salsa were huge. That was different. The first couple of chips I had were underwhelming because they were cold, but then I got to some warm chips that tasted much fresher. It's a very noticeable difference. The food came out rather quickly, which was surprising considering how long it took to be acknowledged in the beginning. I enjoyed the rice & black beans. The chicken in my enchilada reminded me of canned chicken. It really didn't have a lot of flavor. The enchilada relied on the red sauce for taste and I wasn't very impressed. Also our last water refills tasted odd, like it shared a spout with some variety of lemonade that got mixed in with the water. Not good. But I'm glad I had a chance to remind myself what Aunt Chilada's food is like. I see no need to drive out to the east valley to eat here again.

I was here on business for a week and decided to stop in for lunch with some other guys. I am from an area with a rather large hispanic population and as such I frequent Mexican and other hispanic places frequently and one thing that I noticed is that their prices are steep...but that could just be a cost of living difference. I had the buffet which included several chimichanga's rice, beans, and salad. Everything tasted great. They brought out typical nachos and salsa which did not push the envelope by any means. The mild salsa was pretty much diced tomatoes. The hot was not very hot at all. The staff was friendly and attentive. We were in and out pretty fast despite a lunch rush. Its a good find.

I had been here years ago I double checked online to see if the menu had changed and it seemed the same... well once I got there there was at least six items that were no longer... that's fine.. I will get something else...chips were 2 day old at least so so stale... the food was just as bad. Will never come back it was really really bad.
5 stars for Jeff the bartender!  Best margarita in town!!  He felt with our crowd like a pro!

On a hot summer day in early August upon deciding to eat Mexican food, we arrived at Aunt Chiladas and were immediately greeted by a young dapper server named Connor. Upon being seated in a cozy corner facing a pond with two lively ducks, we were brought an excess of warm chips and refreshing salsa. Our server Connor, who I might add was speedy, charming, and friendly, recommended us margaritas and in the blink of an eye they were bestowed upon us like mana from the heavens. During our meal, Connor also brought us different salsas to try out. After our tongues were seared with the intangible and unrelenting pain of ghost peppers, Connor brought us milk without even being asked to. Throughout our meal he was extremely attentive and even gave an excellent demonstration of how to prepare authentic guacamole. Thank you for the great service, we will definitely  be going again soon and sitting in Connor's section.

The kids decided this was "Meh-xican" food. I have to agree that it was just OK. Our waitress was nice and attentive, but the food was pretty bland; even the jalapeños lacked bite.  I'd read other reviews to beware that the salsa here was spicier than at most places -- I've got to say that was definitely NOT my experience. I don't know if they've gotten complaints and default to a mild version for the tourists, but ours was little more than tomato sauce with a few onions in it.  On the plus side, the kids absolutely LOVED their cheese crisps.
Great location because onsite at the resort.  Service so so.  Chips not good. Salsa fresh.  Street tacos - chicken not good. Steak good.   Queso dip ...not a hit.

Went with friends for lunch last week. I've never been- the atmosphere is fun, the place is huge and has an large outdoor seating area. Its like a Macayos on steroids. Anyway, the food was good, and the service would good also. Except for when my friend wanted a simple substitution. Before we know it, 10 minutes have gone by, I've had an entire conversation about something else with the 3rd person in our party and another staff person was brought over. One of my friends called ordering lunch "negotiating". The poor guy gave up and ordered something else entirely. It was good, it was just a weird experience.

Stopped by for a late lunch so we missed the crowd. There were a good amount of cars in the parking lot, but service wasn't bad. Heard terrible things about the place but had to try it for myself. Sat out on the patio under an umbrella. Nice if you don't mind the resident ducks staring you down for chips. They don't bother that much if you don't feed em. Ordered a grande strawberry margarita. Very good. The salsa wasn't anything special but the chips were fresh. Ordered the 2 enchilada plate with rice and beans, one chx one shredded beef. She order a chx burrito. It took longer than we expected to get the food out but was good and filling. Spendy though for 2 plates and 3 grande margaritas ~$70. I'd go back.
The rice is fluffy, the salsa is perfectly mild, the green corn tamale is wonderful. The service is fast and friendly.

I dined here once on a date. Needless to say, the date that evening went south. Anyhow, I found the service here average and the time to receive our meal was unusually long -like 20 minutes. The food was fairly bland and not very flavorful and the chips and tortillas seemed to not be very fresh. However, the one redeeming factor is their quesadillas are huge and they don't skimp on the cheese.   This place is fairly average and you won't impress any dates here. But if you need some Mexican food near Arizona Mills, it's alright.

This was absolutely the WORST food I have ever eaten.  The owner and chef should be embarrassed about the lack of quality food they are serving.   I ate their last night with some co-workers and the queso was thick and over cooked, similar to what the queso looks like at the bottom of a crock pot.  I order enchiladas and a taco.  They brought me a shredded taco instead of a ground beef taco so I sent it back. When the new taco arrived and I went to take a bite the shell was stale.  I immediately spit it out lost my appetite and had to go home hungry.  I would have rather gone across the street to Burger King then eat that food.

I had such a lovely experience at this restaurant with my friend. We enjoyed the food so much! The Chicken Tortilla Soup was delicious. The traditional chicken burrito was huge and so delicious! I am not sure what the sauce was that I had on it but it was wonderful! I don't normally drink but the drinks we had were quite delicious too. The waiter was lovely. The atmosphere was terrific. I hope to visit Arizona again and eat there again!

2 words: not good. The mexican food here is as far from authentic as you can get, plus it is overpriced. I got the chicken tortilla soup to start off with and it was soooo bland and flavorless and loaded with tons of cheesy goop. Then I got a taco and tostada and both were of lower standards than taco bell (I would have preferred a taco bell taco). When I go to a Mexican restaurant in Arizona I expect a freshly fried taco shell, not your store bought Ortega brand taco shell and I expect shredded beef, but at Aunt Chilada's you get the store bought shells and ground beef! I won't return.

Horrible, horrible, horrible!  Not related (for a very long time, apparently, to the other one with the same name in north Phoenix). Oops. Wish I'd found that out before agreeing to be seated.  Friendly, enough, staff.   Strange layout. We were seated in what looked to have formerly been an outdoor area. It's a separate building. Once seated, we were forgotten for close to 20 minutes.  Finally chips, salsa and waters arrived. Decent salsa.  The beef was not referred to as "steak" for any of their selections. Might have been a subtle tip that the meat quality is off. And, that's polite. Was it even beef? Not sure. Where was it cut from? The serving staff didn't know when asked and didn't seem inclined to go find out.  It was so bad that more than 3/4ths of the meals were left uneaten. No "to go" boxes. No thank you. Eew. Take it away! And, no interest in going for a dessert. Every good meal deserves a dessert to cap it off, right?  North Phoenix, here I come.

I loved the ambiance and wonderful colorful patio. I judge all Mexican restaurants by their chili rellenos, and this one was a winner. Very fresh and flavorful. The service was attentive and helpful. The most exciting discovery was on the dessert menu. They have sopapillas!!!!! Having grown up eating the Mexican/New Mexican food in Colorado and New Mexico sopapillas were a special part of every meal. I was shocked when I found that California and Arizona do not follow that fabulous tradition. Hence, my 20+ year quest to find good sopapillas without having to drive to Santa Fe. To say I am delighted to find them 5 miles from my home is an understatement. For those unfamiliar, a sopapilla is a flaky piece of fried bread, puffed up into a pillow just perfect for drizzling honey inside. The sopapillas here were perfect. This makes a return visit to Aunt Child's a necessity. Treat yourself to great food and finish with the sopapillas!!!

The appetizer platter we received was really good. Me and my husband enjoyed that. We also got chicken fitijas and was definitely not impressed but it. There was no flavor at all in the plate. Other than that it was okay. Would we eat again. Maybe. We were celebrating our 1 year anniversary so we tried it out

I think the food was OK. Not great, but a cute little place. But the five stars is for our server, Lucero, an absolutely lovely gem of a young lady.   Additionally, we were also pleased with the attentiveness of the other server, Kyle.    The best part of a restaurant experience is the service staff and  I hope that the management of this establishment rewards them appropriately and does their best to retain and reward such talent.

I really like this place. One of the better Mexican restaurants in the valley. They have great food and their prices weren't outrageous. I sat outside right by a heater... it was heaven. The service was good. Our food was brought out to us right away, but the waiter neglected to notice our empty drink cups. I understand it was busy, and he looked like he was the only one outside at the time, but we were thirsty! All in all, I was satisfied. After we eat there, we usually go and sit up on South Mountain and watch the city lights and walk off the food, lol.

I'd give this place 2.5 stars. The black beans and rice were very good, but my entree - the chile relleno - was lacking. It was smothered in delicious cheese and the fried breading was just ok. I'm not sure what the pepper was stuffed with, but it didn't really taste like anything.   I ordered the Patron margarita with liqueur and lime juice  because I dislike the house kind that comes from a mix, but this one still didn't taste 100% homemade (like they cut it with a little mix or something). The chips and salsa were just ok.   This place is nice for it's convenient location next to the Arizona Grand, but I was a little disappointed by my visit. Good I suppose if you want very Americanized Mexican fare.

This was our first meal when we arrived in the Phoenix area. The food was decent and the margaritas were pretty awesome. We sat on the patio on a beautiful day so we will be back for that alone. The service was good, but a little slow so I wouldn't want to dine here is I was in a hurry. My chili rellano was awesome, but my daughter was not crazy about the shredded beef enchiladas. We also ordered the bean dip, which was a little cold but decent. All in all an ok meal.

Showed up with a party of 5 at 7pm on a Tuesday night.  Was seated promptly and got chips and salsa quickly.  After 20 minutes no server showed up.  Went to hostess that seated us and told her.  No apology just turned to the back and left me standing there.  After another 10 minutes of eating chips and salsa we decided to leave.  Passing the hostess I told her that we were going somewhere else to eat.  She smiled sweetly and told me to have a nice evening.  I asked to speak to a manager.  Manager made no apology but did explain that the server in my area was new but wouldn't be around for long.  I asked what good that would do me now.  She said no good.  Worst experience ever!  Have been going here with visitors for years and have never been treated so poorly.  No one apologized but I guess someone would have to care  before apologizing.

I had the green chile burrito and I kid you not, it looked like dog food. Came close to tasting like it as well. Not authentic Mexican food at all, if you want Americanized Mexican food then maybe but I would not recommend.

Stopped by one night for dinner and was seated immediately.  I was somewhat disappointed with the menu which was heavy on cheese and fried stuff.  I would have loved to have seen a mole dish. on the menu.  I ended up with the Southwestern Caesar Salad (super tasty dressing), which was okay.  I would not come back again if I were in town again.  I'd try the Sonoran hot dog cart on the corner of Baseline and Priest instead.

Went for Cinco de Mayo drinks and was totally underwhelmed. It wasn't that busy, but the service was horrifically slow, the chips tasted stale, there was no music, and they overcharged us for happy hour drinks.   They get an extra star since their salsa and margarita's were decent though. I'd agree with the other reviewers here that this place is just okay. There are certainly better restaurants out there.

I went there last night for dinner with friends. It's a HUUUGE place...doesn't look that big from the outside, but it's a sprawling establishment. Around 6:30 on a Thursday, they were running full. I would have loved to sit outside on the patio because the weather was so perfect, but we just opted for the first available seats, which were inside. My friend was hungry, so she ordered the Aunt Chilada dip (refried beans, sour cream, guac, and ground beef), and some drinks from the bar. Nothing stellar so far. The waitress came to take our orders as soon as we sat down. I got the Tacos de Pescado, my friends got flautas and tamales. We got salsa and chips to start with. The order came really fast, while we were still finishing our starters. I liked my tacos, though I wish the fish was a little more flavorful and spicy. I added lemon juice liberally and salsa, which made up for the blandness somewhat. My friends said their food was good, though far from authentic. I give three stars to this place mostly because of its ambience. I wish the waitresses would give diners more time at the table though..i felt a tad rushed. But maybe that was because of the crowd. Yeah, I can sure go back here again.

It's not great... but it's not awful. A little overpriced for mediocre food. Love the spinach enchiladas. If you're in the area and there's nowhere else close by you want to travel for Mexican, it will do.
We went here for the first time about a week ago and it was awesome! It was kind of slow for a weeknight but service and food were great, we'll definitely be back!

Loved this place!  We stumbled upon it after arriving from out of town.  The waiter we had was wonderful, the food was awesome and the atmosphere was also pleasant.  Too bad they're associated with the Arizona Grand.

The food is edible, but not good. I have been there a few times and have always sat outside which is a nice patio area.  However, a nice patio does not overcome the bland food and mediocre service. You are in Arizona, there is much better Mexican food to be eaten.

I went here for lunch today and was not impressed, although the service was great. Our waitress was friendly and easily split our check for the 6 of us at the table paying separately. There is no lunch menu so the prices were $11-18 per meal. The chips and salsa were delicious but the meal left more to be desired. I got the chicken tostada with refried beans and rice. The chicken was pretty bland and the rice and beans were just okay. I probably would only be back if they offered lunch prices or happy hour.

The happy hour in the bar is amazing. The best deals I ever seen. From 3-4, $3.00 wine and appetizers, certain well drinks and beer too at $3.00, from 4-5, prices go to $4.00, etc.  Clare is the best bartender since the TV show Cheers. Oh and the Pinot Grigio there is sublime.  Do NOT NOT miss the bean dip.  Dinner there is amazing. I had the Mexican Ceasar salad with mesquite grilled shrimp on it and a side of Fideo, the only place in town that has Fideo. They could cook it like crap if they wanted to but they don't love love love Aunt Chiladas! pictures on Instram @lidsamy
This place is amazing. Coming from Texas & eating tons of Mexican food.. this place beats all of it!
So in love with the queso dip. I could have jist eaten that all night long.  We were told Wait time was 40 min. But we got seated after only 15 min. Woot Woot! The shredded chicken tacos were legit

Wow, this place is just not good.  Went there for lunch and first off the chips and salsa were terrible. The salsa tasted worse than pace from a grocery store jar. Then came my "taco salad".  I asked if instead of meat I could have refried beans. Okay, so my $13 "taco salad" consisted of a shell with iceburg lettuce and a ladel full of refried beans on the top. That's it. Yeah. That's it.  Oh, I did get some sour cream and guac on the side of the plate, but no tomtatoes in the salad, not even a little onion or garnish or anything. Just iceberg lettuce and refried beans poured on top. It was gross!!  And it was $13 dollars!!  Give me a break.  My husband ordered a black bean chimichanga. The beans were soggy and refried style black beans, no flavor or spice, totally boring. The food was seriously terrible and ridiculously expensive. We spent over $30 on that crappy crap of a terrible lunch and will never go back there.
If you want slow service & decent food for an expensive price this is the place to go! Food was decent but there's better places for less money. Try popos fiesta Del sol.

Couldn't decide where to eat.   Must eat.  Driving in circles.  Must eat.  Want to run over the first a-hole that comes between me and food.  Found this place by mistake.  Family was too hungry to be picky and could not take the 2 seconds to look it up on Yelp.  So we went off the grid.  The service was friendly and attentive.  At one point, they made a mistake and brought our table a second beer.  Which they gave to us, for making the mistake.  Don't get me wrong, I was going to give them a good review anyway, the free beer was just icing on the cake.  The food was very fresh.  Right down to the chips and salsa.  I certainly think that it could  have used more heat, but I feel the same way about water.  I was craving some Chile Verde, so went with the pork.  Not what I had expected.  I was thinking pork marinaded in green sauce.  It was grilled pork fillets that were seasoned to perfection.  It was outstanding.  The Fajita plate had a little more heat, not nearly enough for me, but plenty for my wife.    Kids had quasadilla and were treated like kings.  I highly recommend this place.  Great atmosphere, great food and most importantly a moat around the front.

I ate here as part of a work function.  They have amazing chips and salsa.  That was probably the best part of my meal.  I love Mexican food and could eat it literally every day - but I found this to be a very very Americanized version of Mexican food.  It was "Eh" - not bad, not great...just "Eh". The best part of the meal were the chips, they were delicious and the salsa was amazing.  I like spicy food and the salsa delivered - but everything else was so mild and just forgetable. There were a lot of us in the group and our food kept coming out in waves.  The first batch of people served started eating and were more than half way done their meal by the time the third wave was served.  I believe our large group plus the large number of diners that were already there very likely overwhelmed the kitchen staff.  We had a reservation, perhaps they could have scheduled a few more people.  The server herself was good, she was on the spot with drinks, refills and more chips.  I don't know how much the bill was because the check was picked up by my boss, but if I were paying for dinner, I don't know that I would come back here if other options were available.

Why so many bad reviews? This place was yummy! My guy and I just had lunch there (Him- steak & shrimp fajitas Me-Burro Verde) everything was good, both food & service. Glad we ignored some bad reviews & tried it :)

Had a business meeting here, locals brought me.  Now I go every time I'm in town, and if my niece who lives here is available she joins me. I recommend the beef enchiladas, with charro style  beans and rice. Chili relleno is as good, I order both!

I went here while on lunch this past Friday with a co-worker. I have to admit, I was pleasantly surprised with their items on their menu. I ordered the 2 shredded chicken enchiladas with black beans and rice & it was delicious! The portions were really big! My coworker also ordered 2 enchiladas, one cheese one shredded chicken & she also said they were really good. Her sides she chose were rice & fidello. I was surprised to notice that they offered fidello, she said it was really good.  I was most excited that I only paid about $16.00 with a drink & $4.00 for a tip, so total of $20 for really good food, great service & VERY LARGE portions. I would recommend this place to others. They have a nice patio area where you can sit outside & there is a man made pond, which was very nice. They also offer happy hour daily so thats a plus!

Its amazing how much they are charging for their flavorless greasy food. I was so underwhelmed I felt obligated to write this here review, which is also appropriately underwhelming. The best thing about the meal was the iced tea. Oh, I guess the service was decent.
